basics.name: Abraham Alpuerto
basics.label: M.S. Computer and Systems Engineering Student
basics.summary: Computer and Systems Engineering student with a strong foundation in Deep Learning, LLMs, and Hardware-Software integration. Experience in architecting autonomous agent systems and financial forecasting models.

work.name: Columbia Secure FinAI Lab
work.summary: Focus on Agent-based systems and LLMs.
highlights: Authored paper ('Orchestration Framework for Financial Agents...') accepted for poster presentation at a NeurIPS 2025 Workshop.
Engineered a novel RAG agent to autonomously reason over a dynamic Neo4j knowledge graph.
Architected and fine-tuned a specialized LLM agent using LoRA (PEFT) on a custom dataset of 25,000+ Q&A pairs.
Connected AI Agents using MCP and A2A protocols to streamline communications.

work.name: Independent Research
work.summary: Architected novel forecasting models for financial equities.
highlights: Developed a model using LSTM and Attention mechanisms to predict price changes.
Engineered a data pipeline to preprocess 10+ years of daily data for 50+ equities.
Created 18 distinct predictive indicators through feature engineering.

work.name: Smart Wheelchair Project
highlights: Developed a scalable Flask backend to ingest real-time sensor data.
Designed relational MySQL database schema for user profiles and large-scale sensor readings.
Built secure RESTful APIs with JWT authentication.

awards.title: The Rensselaer Medal
awards.summary: Premier merit scholarship ($160,000 value). Awarded to a top engineering student transferring from Mohawk Valley CC based on academic achievement.

certificates.name: Qiskit Global Summer School 2024 - Quantum Excellence
certificates.summary: Completed an intensive two-week curriculum on utility-scale quantum computing. Mastered Qiskit SDK v1.x, quantum circuit transpilation, and noise-model building through 4 graded laboratories.

certificates.name: IBM Quantum Challenge 2024 Achievement
certificates.summary: Solved advanced coding challenges using Qiskit 1.0. Implemented Variational Quantum Classifiers (VQC), error mitigation strategies, and circuit knitting techniques for large-scale quantum processors.

publications.name: Orchestration Framework for Financial Agents: From Algorithmic Trading to Agentic Trading
publications.publisher: NeurIPS 2025 Workshop on Generative AI in Finance
publications.summary: Proposed an end-to-end orchestration framework mapping traditional algorithmic trading components to specialized AI agents using MCP and A2A protocols.

projects.name: Canine Image Classification
projects.summary: Benchmarked KNN vs CNN on a custom dataset of 2,000 images.
